intro: Melandrium keiskei, commonly known as the Keiske's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its seed capsules split open to release tiny seeds. Melandrium keiskei is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in cooler climates.
